name: The Global Entry
description: Flexible points that transfer to high-value partners like Hyatt, plus unbeatable travel insurance.

slots.name: The Hub
slots.description: The core card that unlocks transfer partners and travel insurance.

slots.name: The Point Generator
slots.description: Earns points faster on everyday purchases to transfer to your Hub.

rules.title: The Anchor
rules.description: The Sapphire Reserve is your hub. It unlocks 50% more value for travel and enables point transfers.

rules.title: The Accumulator
rules.description: Use Freedom Unlimited for everything else. Move those points to your Sapphire account to boost their value.

rules.title: The Redemption
rules.description: Transfer points to World of Hyatt. A 30k point night at a Park Hyatt can be worth $1,000+.

name: Wallet Freak
description: You are the final boss of this game. You track every portal, every transfer partner, every retention offer, and you make the issuers cry.

slots.name: Premium Hub
slots.description: Lounge access and transfer partners.

slots.name: Dining & Grocery
slots.description: Maximum multipliers on food.

slots.name: Catch-All
slots.description: For everything else.

rules.title: Maximize Credits
rules.description: Ensure you use every single monthly credit (Uber, Dining, etc.) to offset the high fees.

rules.title: Retention Offers
rules.description: Call every year when the annual fee hits to ask for a retention offer.

rules.title: Business Cards
rules.description: Use business cards to keep your personal credit report clean and earn more points.

name: Points Strategist
description: You want transferable points and know every sweet spot redemption. You don't need Amex Platinum coupons — you just want the highest cents-per-point possible.

slots.name: The Hub
slots.description: Your main travel card.

slots.name: The Multiplier
slots.description: Earns 2x-3x on categories.

rules.title: Transfer Partners
rules.description: Never redeem for cash back. Always transfer to airline or hotel partners.

rules.title: The Duo
rules.description: Combine cards from the same ecosystem (e.g. Capital One Duo or Chase Trifecta) to pool points.

name: Business Powerhouse
description: You run real money through cards — ads, software, inventory, shipping, travel. You want uncapped 3–5x on the categories that matter most to your business.

slots.name: Ad Spend & Software
slots.description: 4x points on top business categories.

slots.name: Flat Rate Business
slots.description: 2x or 1.5x on all other business spend.

rules.title: Separate Expenses
rules.description: Keep business expenses strictly on business cards for easier accounting.

rules.title: Employee Cards
rules.description: Issue cards to employees to earn points on their spend too.

name: Cashback Pragmatist
tagline: Points Are a Scam, Give Me Cash
description: You want real cash, no games, no portals, no annual fees (or tiny ones).

slots.name: Flat Rate
slots.description: 2% cash back on everything.

slots.name: Category Booster
slots.description: 5% on your top category.

rules.title: Keep it Simple
rules.description: Focus on cards with no annual fee and high cash back rates.

rules.title: Auto-Redeem
rules.description: Set up auto-redemption to your bank account so you never have to think about it.

name: Foodie & Grocery King
description: Your biggest spend is eating. You need the absolute highest return on restaurants, grocery stores, and food delivery.

slots.name: Dining & Groceries
slots.description: The heavy hitters for food spend.

slots.name: Supermarkets
slots.description: 6% back at US supermarkets.

rules.title: Dining Credits
rules.description: Use the monthly dining credits on the Gold card to offset the fee.

rules.title: Grocery Cap
rules.description: Watch out for the $6k annual cap on the Blue Cash Preferred.

name: Simple Minimalist
description: You want one card that does everything reasonably well and you never want to think about it again.

slots.name: The One Card
slots.description: Your daily driver for everything.

rules.title: Set and Forget
rules.description: Put everything on autopay and use this one card for every purchase.

name: Value Traveler
tagline: Good travel perks without the pain
description: You love travel but want the fee easily offset. Venture X and CSP are your sweet spot.

slots.name: Travel Hub
slots.description: Great value travel card.

slots.name: Everyday
slots.description: Earns points on daily spend.

rules.title: Hotel Credit
rules.description: Use the $50 hotel credit on the Sapphire Preferred to reduce the effective fee.

rules.title: Transfer Partners
rules.description: Learn to use Hyatt or airline partners for outsized value.

name: Category Hunter
description: You activate every quarterly category and love stacking offers.

slots.name: Rotating Categories
slots.description: 5% back on changing categories.

slots.name: Custom Category
slots.description: 5% on your top spend category.

rules.title: Activate Quarterly
rules.description: Set a reminder to activate your 5% categories every quarter.

rules.title: Max Out
rules.description: Try to hit the $1,500 spend cap on the 5% categories.

name: Student Starter
description: You're in school or just graduated, want no annual fee, high rewards on dining/Amazon/Uber, and easy approval.

slots.name: Student Card
slots.description: Great rewards with no credit history needed.

rules.title: Pay in Full
rules.description: Always pay your full balance every month to build good credit.

rules.title: Keep it Open
rules.description: Keep your oldest card open to maintain a long credit history.

name: Yuppie
tagline: Metal cards, city perks, looking rich
description: Young urban professional who wants the heaviest metal cards, Centurion lounge access, Uber credits, Saks credits, and to flex at dinner.

slots.name: Status Symbol
slots.description: The card you pull out to impress.

slots.name: Dining & Lifestyle Credits
slots.description: 4x dining worldwide + monthly credits you actually use.

slots.name: Non-Category
slots.description: 2x on everything else to feed the hub.

rules.title: Flex the Metal
rules.description: Always use the Platinum or Reserve when paying the bill at dinner – it matters.

rules.title: Use Every Credit
rules.description: Uber, Saks, airline fee, hotel collection – hit them all or you’re leaving money on the table.

rules.title: Lounge Life
rules.description: Centurion, Delta Sky Club, Priority Pass – make airports your office.

name: Balanced Food & Travel
tagline: Groceries first, dining second, travel when I can
description: Groceries are your biggest spend, restaurants are regular, and you take a few nice trips a year. You want strong grocery/dining rewards with solid travel upside, but nothing too complicated.

slots.name: Food Heavy Hitter
slots.description: High returns on groceries and dining with transfer partner access.

slots.name: Grocery Max Alternative
slots.description: 6% groceries if you’re under the cap and prefer cash.

slots.name: Travel & Catch-All
slots.description: Transferable points for trips or flat-rate on everything else.

rules.title: Food on Gold
rules.description: Put all groceries and dining on the Gold card for 4x Membership Rewards.

rules.title: Use the Credits
rules.description: Hit your $10/month dining and Uber credits religiously – it basically pays the fee.

rules.title: Occasional Big Redemptions
rules.description: Save MR or UR points for a nice Hyatt stay or flight once or twice a year.

name: Family Freak
tagline: Groceries for 6+, Disney+, minivan gas – maxed or nothing
description: Big family = massive grocery bills, endless kids streaming, Amazon Prime addiction, and constant school-run gas. You squeeze every single family dollar for the absolute highest return, stacking cards and offers like a pro.

slots.name: Family Core Beast
slots.description: 6% groceries (to $6k), 6% streaming uncapped, 3% gas & transit – the ultimate family daily driver (2025 meta).

slots.name: Overflow Grocery & Dining
slots.description: After $6k grocery cap → 4x unlimited groceries + 4x dining worldwide.

slots.name: Rotating Family Boosters
slots.description: Wholesale clubs, Amazon, Target, Walmart when they hit 5%.

slots.name: Amazon & Online Addiction
slots.description: Diapers, toys, everything delivered.

rules.title: Blue Cash Preferred First
rules.description: Groceries, streaming, gas stations, Uber for kid pickups – always this card until caps hit.

rules.title: Switch at $6k
rules.description: Hit $6,000 grocery cap on BCP → immediately switch all food spend to Gold for 4x.

rules.title: Quarterly Wholesale Runs
rules.description: Stock up at Costco/Sam’s/Target the second wholesale clubs rotate in – combine with gift cards from grocery runs.

rules.title: Credit Stacking
rules.description: Use every Gold dining/Uber/Grubhub credit – that’s free money for family takeout nights.

name: Gas Freak
description: Long commute, road trips, or EV owner — every gallon or kWh must earn the absolute maximum rewards, stacked to hell.

slots.name: Quarterly Gas Rotator
slots.description: 5% when gas stations or EV charging is in rotation.

slots.name: Custom Gas Maxer
slots.description: Lock in gas stations or EV charging as your 5% category.

slots.name: Backup Gas Card
slots.description: Reliable 3%+ on gas when no 5% is active.

rules.title: Quarterly Activation
rules.description: Activate the second the new quarter drops — gas and EV charging appear often.

rules.title: Stack Fuel Apps
rules.description: Always run Upside or fuel-specific apps on top of card rewards.

name: Drugstore Freak
description: You live at CVS, Walgreens, Rite Aid every week buying gift cards, deals, and whatever moves the needle.

slots.name: Quarterly Drugstore Rotator
slots.description: 5% when drugstores are quarterly.

slots.name: Custom Drugstore Maxer
slots.description: Lock drugstores as your permanent 5% category.

slots.name: Gift Card Stack
slots.description: Amex offers and store deals on gift cards.

rules.title: Gift Card Runs
rules.description: Buy $500 Visa/MC gift cards whenever possible to move spend or meet bonuses.

rules.title: Stack Every Offer
rules.description: Amex Offers, Chase Offers, store coupons, Ibotta — layer everything.

name: Online Shopping Freak
tagline: 5–6% online or I’m not buying it
description: Everything is bought online — Amazon, Target, Walmart, PayPal, digital goods — you demand the highest return.

slots.name: Quarterly Online Rotator
slots.description: 5% when PayPal, Amazon, Walmart+, etc are quarterly.

slots.name: Custom Online Shopping
slots.description: Choose online shopping as your boosted category.

slots.name: Amazon Prime Beast
slots.description: 5% on Amazon.com with Prime membership.

rules.title: Portal Stacking
rules.description: Always check Rakuten/TopCashback + card for double dip.

rules.title: PayPal Everywhere
rules.description: Use PayPal whenever possible to hit quarterly categories.

name: Office Supply Freak
description: You buy gift cards at office supply stores to manufacture spend, meet bonuses, or liquidate.

slots.name: Office Supply Maxer
slots.description: 5% on office supply stores + internet/cable/phone (up to $25k/year).

slots.name: Backup Business Catch-All
slots.description: When you hit the cap or for non-office spend.

rules.title: Gift Card Liquidation
rules.description: Staples Visa/MC gift cards are your best friend for meeting SUBs.

rules.title: Utilities Bonus
rules.description: Pay phone/internet/cable bills with Ink Cash for 5%.

name: Streaming Freak
tagline: 6% streaming or I cancel the sub
description: You subscribe to everything — Netflix, Spotify, Disney+, Apple, Hulu — and you demand max rewards on every subscription.

slots.name: Streaming Maxer
slots.description: 6% on select U.S. streaming services (no cap).

slots.name: Backup Streaming Cards
slots.description: 3%+ streaming when you need alternatives.

rules.title: No Cap = Unlimited
rules.description: Blue Cash Preferred has no cap on streaming — put every subscription here.

rules.title: Bundle for Extra
rules.description: Use bundles (Disney+/Hulu, Spotify Family) to maximize one card swipe.
